title: My Arm's Big Adventure/Quick guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Items needed: Climbing boots or 12 coins

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:My Arm's Big Adventure/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point The kitchen, deep in the Troll Stronghold. Talk to Burntmeat.
Official difficultyExperienced
DescriptionTrolls love goutweed. They love it so much that they've picked it all, and now they can't get any more. However, in his smelly kitchen in the Troll Stronghold, Burntmeat the cook has heard a rumour that goutweed is growing once again, for anyone who's got the skill to farm it. Can you teach his young assistant - a simple troll known as My Arm - to grow the precious goutweed? Will you overcome My Arm's stubbornness and ignorance to earn yourself Burntmeat's reward? Dare you accompany My Arm on this uniquely trollish expedition?
Official lengthMedium
Requirements
  • 29 Farming (boostable)
  • 10 Woodcutting (not boostable) to cut thatches and repair the fence for Tai Bwo Wannai favour, otherwise you will have to kill monsters spawned by other players
  • Completion of the following quests:
    • Eadgar's Ruse
      • Druidic Ritual
      • Troll Stronghold
        • Death Plateau
    • The Feud
    • Jungle Potion
  • At least 60% favour in the Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup minigame before starting this quest - this will be subtracted from the total favour
Items required
  • Bucket (can be obtained during the quest, south of the cooking pot on Death Plateau)
  • 3 Ugthanki dung, or the following materials to gather it:
    • Gloves
    • Red hot sauce (obtainable in Pollniveach) or the Camulet (from Enakhra's Lament quest)
    • Spade
    • 3 additional buckets
  • Several farming supplies, which can be stored by any Tool Leprechaun and withdrawn from the Trollheim Tool Leprechaun - except for Supercompost, these may also be purchased from this Leprechaun:
    • 8 Supercompost (must be Supercompost)
    • Spade
    • Rake
    • Seed dibber
    • Plant cure
Recommended
  • 55 Combat level
  • 43 Prayer (not boostable) for Protection prayers
  • 61 Magic (boostable)for Trollheim Teleport
  • Fast travel to Al-Kharid (ring of dueling or amulet of glory) or Pollnivneach (Pollnivneach Teleport or coins to use the magic carpet system) to obtain Ugthanki Dung
  • Fast travel to Death Plateau (games necklace to Burthorpe or combat bracelet to the Warriors' Guild)
  • Climbing boots, if walking from the Troll Stronghold to Death Plateau (can be bought from Tenzing for 12 coins)
  • Stamina or energy potions
  • Food, armour, and a weapon
Enemies to defeat
  • Baby Roc (level 75)
  • Giant Roc (level 172)

Talk to [[Burntmeat]].","length":"Medium","items":"*[[Bucket]] (can be obtained during the quest, south of the cooking pot on [[Death Plateau (location)|Death Plateau]])\n*3 [[Ugthanki dung]], or the following materials to gather it:\n**[[Gloves]]\n**[[Red hot sauce]] (obtainable in [[Pollniveach]]) '''or''' the [[Camulet]] (from [[Enakhra's Lament]] quest)\n**[[Spade]]\n**3 additional [[bucket]]s\n*Several farming supplies, which can be stored by any [[Tool Leprechaun]] and withdrawn from the [[Tool Leprechaun (Larry)|Trollheim Tool Leprechaun]] - except for Supercompost, these may also be purchased from this Leprechaun:\n**8 [[Supercompost]] (must be Supercompost)\n**[[Spade]]\n**[[Rake]]\n**[[Seed dibber]]\n**[[Plant cure]]"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

The adventurer[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Climbing boots or 12 coins

  • Go to the Troll Stronghold, head south then downstairs into the kitchen (fairycode AJR and enter from the back through the secret door where you freed the prisoners, or utilise a slayer ring and enter the mountain through the secret entrance, or Trollheim teleport and go west).
  • Speak to Burntmeat. ( 1•2)…
    1What do you want now?
    2Alright, I'll lend him a hand.
  • Talk to My Arm, east of Burntmeat.

Getting the goutweed[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Three buckets of Ugthanki dung, seven buckets of supercompost (or 7 supercompost stored in the Tool Leprechaun), a spade, climbing boots, empty bucket (no need to bring one, there is one south of the Death Plateau cooking pot), at least one free inventory slot.

  • Reach the Death Plateau. (Games necklace or minigame teleport to Burthorpe). There will be thrower trolls on the way there and on the plateau itself; protect from ranged.
  • Use a bucket on the cooking pot in the middle of the plateau with 1 free inventory space to get the goutweedy lump.
    • A bucket spawns south of the cooking pot, if you forgot to bring one.
  • Go back to the Troll Stronghold and talk to My Arm.
  • After he brings you to a new area, talk to him again.
  • After reading the book he gave you, talk to him again.
  • Use three buckets of Ugthanki dung and seven buckets of supercompost on the soil patch.
  • Talk to My Arm.
  • Talk to Captain Barnaby. ( 1)…
    1This is My Arm. We'd like to go to Karamja.

Getting the tubers[edit | edit source]

Items needed: None if you already have 60% favour in Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup. If not, you'll need a machete, or at least 60 coins to buy one from the store north-west of the village.

Note: If you plan on completing Karamja medium task diary, you may want to consider getting 100% favour first as you will lose the 60% here.

  • Meet up with My Arm at Tai Bwo Wannai, east of the general store. Talk to him.
  • Talk to Murcaily near the hardwood grove. Make sure you have at least 1 free inventory space. ( 1)…
    1A troll called My Arm wants a favour...
    • If Murcaily cannot be found, log out and log back in.
    • If you don't have 60% favour, raise it to 60% at least and talk to him again (you can't start the quest if you don't have 60% favour).
  • After the cutscene speak to My Arm, you will take the boat back to Ardougne where you can access the bank.

Teaching a troll to farm[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Hardy gout tubers, 17 coins or a rake, seed dibber, plant cure, spade, climbing boots and optionally, supercompost or ultracompost. Remember to bring food for the boss fight to save time.

  • Prepare yourself for a level 75 fight and a level 172 fight.
  • Go back to the roof of the Troll Stronghold by using ladder in the west room on the upper level where the Troll Generals are.
    • Note: Obtain a spade from the Tool leprechaun if you do not already have one.
  • Talk to My Arm.
  • Give My Arm the tools he needs for farming in this order:
    • Rake (if My Arm breaks the rake, pick up the pieces, reassemble it, and give it back to him)
    • Supercompost/Ultracompost (Optional. If ultracompost/supercompost is not used, the patch may become diseased and will need to be cured. Regular compost has no effect.)
    • Hardy gout tubers
    • Seed dibber
    • Plant cure (if patch becomes diseased)
 This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave outside the instance. Any items left on the ground will be lost.
  • Talk to My Arm.
  • Defeat the two monsters.
    • Note: It is possible to dodge the Giant Roc's attacks by moving back and forth between tiles, but it is not possible to dodge its stun attack.

The end[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to My Arm.
  • Give him a spade (if you don't have one, you can go back down and up the ladder to get the leprechaun to reappear).
  • Go back to Burntmeat in the kitchen.
  • Talk to My Arm on the roof.

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 1 Quest point
  • 10,000 Herblore experience
  • 5,000 Farming experience
    • 45×7 additional Farming experience while My Arm harvests his crop.
  • Access to a disease-free herb patch on top of the Troll Stronghold. This patch does not allow growing of regular Goutweed.
  • 29 Burnt meat

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

  • Making Friends with My Arm

==Details==

==Walkthrough==
===The adventurer===
'''''Items needed: '''[[Climbing boots]] or 12 [[coins]]''
{{Checklist|
*Go to the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]], head south then downstairs into the kitchen (fairycode {{Fairycode|AJR}} and enter from the back through the secret door where you freed the prisoners, or utilise a slayer ring and enter the mountain through the secret entrance, or [[Trollheim teleport]] and go west).
*Speak to [[Burntmeat]]. {{Chat option|1What do you want now?|2Alright, I'll lend him a hand.}}
*Talk to [[My Arm]], east of Burntmeat.
}}

===Getting the goutweed===
'''''Items needed: ''' Three buckets of [[Ugthanki dung]], seven buckets of [[supercompost]] (or 7 supercompost stored in the [[Tool Leprechaun]]), a spade, [[climbing boots]], empty bucket (no need to bring one, there is one south of the Death Plateau cooking pot), at least one free inventory slot.''
{{Checklist|
*Reach the [[Death Plateau (location)|Death Plateau]]. ([[Games necklace]] or [[minigame teleport]] to [[Burthorpe]]). There will be [[thrower troll]]s on the way there and on the plateau itself; protect from ranged.
*Use a bucket on the cooking pot in the middle of the plateau with 1 free inventory space to get the [[goutweedy lump]].
**A bucket spawns south of the cooking pot, if you forgot to bring one.
*Go back to the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]] and talk to My Arm.
*After he brings you to a new area, talk to him again.
*After reading the book he gave you, talk to him again.
*Use three buckets of [[Ugthanki dung]] and seven buckets of [[supercompost]] on the soil patch.
*Talk to My Arm.
*Talk to [[Captain Barnaby]]. {{Chat option|1This is My Arm. We'd like to go to Karamja.}}
}}

===Getting the tubers===
'''''Items needed: '''None if you already have 60% favour in [[Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup]]. '''If not''', you'll need a machete, or at least 60 coins to buy one from the store north-west of the village.''

'''''Note: '''If you plan on completing Karamja medium task diary, you may want to consider getting 100% favour first as you will lose the 60% here.''
{{Checklist|
*Meet up with My Arm at [[Tai Bwo Wannai]], east of the [[general store]]. Talk to him.
*Talk to [[Murcaily]] near the hardwood grove. Make sure you have at least 1 free inventory space. {{Chat option|1A troll called My Arm wants a favour...}}
**If Murcaily cannot be found, log out and log back in.
**If you don't have 60% favour, raise it to 60% at least and talk to him again (you can't start the quest if you don't have 60% favour).
*After the cutscene speak to My Arm, you will take the boat back to [[Ardougne]] where you can access the bank.
}}

===Teaching a troll to farm===
'''''Items needed: '''[[Hardy gout tubers]], 17 coins or a [[rake]], [[seed dibber]], [[plant cure]], [[spade]], [[climbing boots]] and optionally, [[supercompost]] or [[ultracompost]]. Remember to bring food for the boss fight to save time.''
{{Checklist|
*Prepare yourself for a level 75 fight and a level 172 fight.
*Go back to the roof of the Troll Stronghold by using ladder in the west room on the upper level where the [[Troll General]]s are.
**Note: Obtain a [[spade]] from the [[Tool leprechaun]] if you do not already have one.
*Talk to My Arm.
*Give My Arm the tools he needs for farming in this order:
**[[Rake]] (if My Arm breaks the rake, pick up the pieces, reassemble it, and give it back to him)
**[[Supercompost]]/[[Ultracompost]] (Optional. If ultracompost/[[supercompost]] is not used, the patch may become diseased and will need to be cured. Regular compost has no effect.)
**[[Hardy gout tubers]]
**[[Seed dibber]]
**[[Plant cure]] (if patch becomes diseased)
{{Instance}}
*Talk to My Arm.
*Defeat the two monsters.
**Note: It is possible to dodge the [[Giant Roc]]'s attacks by moving back and forth between tiles, but it is not possible to dodge its [[Stun (status)|stun]] attack.}}

===The end===
{{Checklist|
*Talk to My Arm.
*Give him a spade '''(if you don't have one, you can go back down and up the ladder to get the leprechaun to reappear). '''
*Go back to [[Burntmeat]] in the kitchen.
*Talk to My Arm on the roof.}}
'''Quest complete!'''

==[[Rewards]]==
{{Quest rewards page|My Arm's Big Adventure}}

==Required for completing==
*[[Making Friends with My Arm]]
